title: Arugula Salad with Prosciutto and Oyster Mushrooms
summary: Need a gluten free and primal side dish? Arugula Salad with Prosciutto and Oyster Mushrooms could be an amazing recipe to try. One portion of this dish contains around 10g of protein, 17g of fat, and a total of 215 calories. This recipe serves 10. For $2.55 per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have prosciutto di parma, baby arugula, lemon zest, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 36%. This score is not so outstanding. Try Penne With Oyster Mushrooms, Prosciutto, and Mint, Penne with Oyster Mushrooms, Prosciutto, and Mint, and Smoked Oyster and Potato Salad with Arugula for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large nonstick skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Cook over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly browned, about 6 minutes. Transfer the mushrooms to a bowl and let cool.                                              In a large bowl, whisk the vinegar with the lemon zest and the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the celery matchsticks, arugula and mushrooms and gently toss. Transfer the salad to a large platter or bowl, top with the Pecorino Toscano, prosciutto and celery leaves and serve right away.

steps.step: In a large nonstick skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil.
Add the mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Cook over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly browned, about 6 minutes.
Transfer the mushrooms to a bowl and let cool.
In a large bowl, whisk the vinegar with the lemon zest and the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the celery matchsticks, arugula and mushrooms and gently toss.
Transfer the salad to a large platter or bowl, top with the Pecorino Toscano, prosciutto and celery leaves and serve right away.
